hive_lesson.title: 1117 Her Dreams
hive_lesson.description: Lindsay talks about what she wanted to be as a child.

hive_text_custom.text: : When I was ten years old I wasn't very
but I knew I wanted to be very powerful so I thought the dream job would be Wonder Woman. She can fly anywhere, she has
and to help everyone and she's very bad ass, so I wanted to be just like her. Unfortunately it didn't come true as I'm not Wonder Woman right now.
: No, I can see that but it seems like you had a good imagination as a kid. But I guess that probably changed as you got older? What about when you were fifteen?

: When I was fifteen I still wanted to be very powerful and very strong but I had a more realistic idea of what I wanted to be, but I still didn't know a lot about the world so I just wanted to be a very powerful businesswoman. I had no idea what kind of business and I had no idea what that actually meant but I wanted to wear an all black suit and have a briefcase and go to work in a nice office and drive a nice car and do something that was very powerful but I had no idea really what a powerful businesswoman does.
: That seems like a pretty good dream for a fifteen year old, but I guess you probably had a better idea when you were twenty. So what about then?
: When I was twenty then I still wanted to be powerful and strong. I guess you can see the

here but then I had an even more realistic idea of actual real professions so at that time I was quite social, I really enjoyed going to parties and I was living in New York at the time so I thought the perfect job for me would be a public relations specialist. I thought I could be one of those people that plans parties or handles the PR, the publicity for celebrities. I had a dream of maybe working for Madonna or working for a famous TV show and handling all their publicity representation.
: That's great. It seems like you had a better idea by the time you were twenty. I guess you probably have some dreams now even, so what kind of dreams do you have now?
: Well then when I was twenty, I was quite

. I just wanted, I only thought about myself and how I could have more money and be more powerful but then something changed when I started traveling and seeing the world where I decided that I'd rather have a job that does something good for the world and gives back to the community and to the people. So now I'm a teacher and I really enjoy that and the idea of

in people's lives and in the future maybe when I get older, I hope to start an animal shelter so that when animals are left on the street or abandoned they can come to my shelter and I can provide a happy home for them.
: Wow, that's a great vision for the future.

answers: a) She can help people.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 1) Why did Lindsay want to be Wonder Woman?

answers: a) To be powerful.
b) To wear black suits.
c) To have a big house.
d) To tell people what to do.
hive_lesson_quiz.question: 2) And why did Lindsay want to be a businesswoman?

answers: a) She wanted to work with celebrities.
b) A friend could get her a job.
c) She was a social person.
d) She liked planning parties.
hive_lesson_quiz.question: 3) Why did Lindsay thing a PR specialist would be the perfect job?

answers: a) She stopped liking parties.
b) She met people from other countries.
c) She wanted to help people.
d) She found a man and got married
hive_lesson_quiz.question: 4) What made Lindsay change her mind about being a PR specialist?

answers: a) Help homeless people.
b) Help homeless animals.
c) Make a difference in people's lives.
d) Have a lot of children.
